alert.note: Alert for Branch; St. Joseph (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued July 12 at 11:04PM EDT until July 12 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern St. Joseph County in southwestern Michigan... Northern Branch County in southwestern Michigan... * Until 1145 PM EDT. * At 1104 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Colon, or 12 miles north of Sturgis, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Coldwater around 1135 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Matteson Lake, Hodunk, Sherwood, Fairfax, Girard and Batavia. This includes Interstate 69 in Michigan between mile markers 11 and 20. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
